channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: OpenAI is ending API access to fan-favorite GPT-4o model in February 2026
item.description: OpenAI has sent out emails notifying API customers that its chatgpt-4o-latest model will be retired from the developer platform in mid-February 2026,. Access to the model is scheduled to end on February 16, 2026, creating a roughly three-month transition period for remaining applications still built on GPT-4o.Sources familiar with the matter emphasized that this timeline applies only to the API. OpenAI has not announced any schedule for removing GPT-4o from ChatGPT, where it remains an option for individual consumers and users across paid subscription tiers. Internally, the model is considered...

item.title: Bret Taylor’s Sierra reaches $100M ARR in under two years
item.description: The startup’s rapid growth suggests that enerprises are embracing AI agents.

item.title: Black Friday scams are everywhere now – here are the 5 best ways to stay safe
item.description: Here are 5 ways to keep fraudsters at bay this Black Friday and ensure your money stays out of scammers’ reach.

item.title: Judge wants to fix Google’s ad tech monopoly before it’s too late
item.description: Google and the Justice Department had their last chance to make their case before Judge Leonie Brinkema Friday before she decides whether Google needs to be broken up to remedy its ad tech monopoly. Brinkema expects to issue her ruling next year, but understands that “time is of the essence,” as Reuters reported. While the […]

item.title: I've found your best first drone for a record-low price, the DJI Mini 4K at Amazon
item.description: DJI's best drone for most beginners hits an all-time low price on Black Friday, starting from $239 / £215

item.title: You can save up to $1,300 on robovacs from Roborock and Eufy ahead of Black Friday
item.description: It’s the most wonderful time of the year, but it can also be the most exhausting. Between hunting for gifts and getting the house ready for guests, it’s easy to get overwhelmed. Thankfully, we’re already seeing steep discounts on robot vacuums ahead of Black Friday, which can at least make the cleaning part feel a […]

item.title: Steve Jobs Hypes Up ‘Toy Story’ and Pixar in Unearthed Interview
item.description: To celebrate the 30th anniverary of 'Toy Story,' the Steve Jobs Archive shared an interview of Jobs singing Pixar's praises.

item.title: You can buy Ray-Ban Meta glasses for their cheapest-ever price thanks to Black Friday
item.description: Forget every other Black Friday deal: you can get Ray-Ban Meta glasses for 20% off.

item.title: Black Friday tablet deals are the best I've ever seen, with the lowest prices on the newest iPad tablets, Galaxy Tab, Amazon Fire and plenty of bargain options
item.description: Black Friday tablet deals span the entire tablet market from the best Galaxy Tab S tablets to the cheapest Amazon Fire tablets, with everything in between. We round up all the best deals here.

item.title: Google Adds Gemini AI-Assistant to Android Auto
item.description: Gemini is spreading its tendrils to millions of additional vehicles.

item.title: WhatsApp security flaw lets experts scrape 3.5 billion user numbers - here's what we know, and how to stay safe
item.description: Study finds WhatsApp contact-discovery flaw allowed scraping of 3.5 billion accounts, exposing metadata and encryption key reuse.

item.title: New to Prime Video? Start with these 3 movies with over 90% on Rotten Tomatoes
item.description: If you've just got your hands on Prime Video, you won't want to miss these movies.

item.title: Amazon starts Prime payouts from $2.5 billion settlement – here's how the refunds work and when you might get one
item.description: Amazon's started paying out $1.5 billion of its record-breaking settlement with the FTC which is earmarked to refund Prime customers.

item.title: Activists Are Using ‘Fortnite’ to Fight Back Against ICE
item.description: Players are role-playing ICE raids in Fortnite and Grand Theft Auto to prepare for real-world situations.

item.title: RFK Jr. Is Now Blaming Vaccines for Peanut Allergies, Despite the Evidence
item.description: At a recent event this week, the health secretary speculated that aluminum in vaccines is causing children's peanut allergies.

item.title: Is Nvidia opening up its NVLink doors even further? New partnership with AMD will see greater integration across many kinds of chips
item.description: Nvidia NVLink Fusion now integrates with Arm-based Neoverse CPUs, enabling hyperscalers and governments to deploy GPUs efficiently in workstations and servers.
